description: Preparation of trace metal stock solutions for cyanobacteria trace metal mixture (CTMM)
before_start:
Before culturing cyanobacteria, read the publication by L.R. Moore et. al. (2007) Limnol. Oceanogr. 5: 353-362.
Purchase the highest quality chemicals to avoid trace metal contamination. 
Acid-wash all re-uesable containers.
protocol_affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, Ohio State University
affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

authors_list.name: Matthew Sullivan Lab
authors_list.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, Ohio State University

guidelines:
Prepare stock trace metal solutions using the amounts below for 100 mL or (50 mL) volumes:

2.30g (1.15g) ZnSO4·7H2O
1.19g (0.595g) CoCl2·6H2O
17.81g (8.905g) MnCl2·4H2O
0.726g (0.636g) Na2MoO4·2H2O
1.73g (0.865g) Na2SeO3
2.38g (1.19g) NiCl2·6H2O

components.data:
Using dust-free weigh paper, weigh out:
2.30g ZnSO4·7H2O
 1.19g CoCl2·6H2O
 17.81g MnCl2·4H2O
 0.726g Na2MoO4·2H2O
 1.73g Na2SeO3
 2.38g NiCl2·6H2O
components.name: Description

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Primary trace metal stocks
source_data.annotation: All reagents used for culturing cyanobacteria should be the highest quality to avoid contamination by trace metals.  Do not use metal spatulas for dispensing the chemicals (use plastic, teflon, or dust-free weighing paper to dispense).  Store reagents in acid-washed teflon or polycarbonate containers.
source_data.thread_text: All reagents used for culturing cyanobacteria should be the highest quality to avoid contamination by trace metals.  Do not use metal spatulas for dispensing the chemicals (use plastic, teflon, or dust-free weighing paper to dispense).  Store reagents in acid-washed teflon or polycarbonate containers.
source_data.body: All reagents used for culturing cyanobacteria should be the highest quality to avoid contamination by trace metals.  Do not use metal spatulas for dispensing the chemicals (use plastic, teflon, or dust-free weighing paper to dispense).  Store reagents in acid-washed teflon or polycarbonate containers.
source_data.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Primary trace metal stocks
source_data.annotation:
Use the highest quality chemicals that are dedicated for cyanobacteria work.
Do not use metal spatulas to transfer chemicals; use plastic or teflon spatulas or dust-free weigh paper to weigh out chemicals.
All re-useable glassware or plastic should be acid-washed and then autoclaved.
source_data.thread_text:

All re-useable glassware or plastic should be acid-washed and then autoclaved.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of Primary trace metal stocks
source_data.annotation: Do not use metal spatulas; use plastic or teflon spatulas or dust-free weigh paper to weigh out chemicals and purchase the highest quality chemicals
source_data.thread_text: Do not use metal spatulas; use plastic or teflon spatulas or dust-free weigh paper to weigh out chemicals and purchase the highest quality chemicals
source_data.body: Do not use metal spatulas; use plastic or teflon spatulas or dust-free weigh paper to weigh out chemicals and purchase the highest quality chemicals
source_data.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

components.data: Transfer each trace metal into separate 100mL volumetric flasks containing about 60 mL Milli-Q water

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of Primary trace metal stocks
source_data.annotation: Alternatively, if prepaing 50 mL volumes, use half the amount of chemical listed and adjust volume to 50 mL mark with Milli-Q water

components.data: Dissolve contents by placing stopper in top and inverting flask several times
components.name: Description

components.data: Adjust volume to 100 mL mark with Milli-Q water
components.name: Description

components.data: Store each stock in acid-washed Teflon or polycarbonate (i.e., Nalgene) bottles at 4°C
components.name: Description
